57#include <openssl/asn1.h>
58#include <openssl/cipher.h>
59#include <openssl/evp.h>
60#include <openssl/obj.h>
61#include <openssl/x509.h>
62
63#include "internal.h"
64
65
66long X509_get_version(const X509 *x509)
67{
68 // The default version is v1(0).
69 if (x509->cert_info->version == NULL) {
70 return X509_VERSION_1;
71 }
72 return ASN1_INTEGER_get(x509->cert_info->version);
73}
74
75int X509_set_version(X509 *x, long version)
76{
77 // TODO(davidben): Reject invalid version numbers.
78 if (x == NULL)
79 return (0);
80 if (version == 0) {
81 ASN1_INTEGER_free(x->cert_info->version);
82 x->cert_info->version = NULL;
83 return (1);
84 }
85 if (x->cert_info->version == NULL) {
86 if ((x->cert_info->version = ASN1_INTEGER_new()) == NULL)
87 return (0);
88 }
89 return (ASN1_INTEGER_set(x->cert_info->version, version));
90}
91
92int X509_set_serialNumber(X509 *x, const ASN1_INTEGER *serial)
93{
94 ASN1_INTEGER *in;
95
96 if (x == NULL)
97 return (0);
98 in = x->cert_info->serialNumber;
99 if (in != serial) {
100 in = ASN1_INTEGER_dup(serial);
101 if (in != NULL) {
102 ASN1_INTEGER_free(x->cert_info->serialNumber);
103 x->cert_info->serialNumber = in;
104 }
105 }
106 return (in != NULL);
107}
108
109int X509_set_issuer_name(X509 *x, X509_NAME *name)
110{
111 if ((x == NULL) || (x->cert_info == NULL))
112 return (0);
113 return (X509_NAME_set(&x->cert_info->issuer, name));
114}
115
116int X509_set_subject_name(X509 *x, X509_NAME *name)
117{
118 if ((x == NULL) || (x->cert_info == NULL))
119 return (0);
120 return (X509_NAME_set(&x->cert_info->subject, name));
121}
122
123int X509_set1_notBefore(X509 *x, const ASN1_TIME *tm)
124{
125 ASN1_TIME *in;
126
127 if ((x == NULL) || (x->cert_info->validity == NULL))
128 return (0);
129 in = x->cert_info->validity->notBefore;
130 if (in != tm) {
131 in = ASN1_STRING_dup(tm);
132 if (in != NULL) {
133 ASN1_TIME_free(x->cert_info->validity->notBefore);
134 x->cert_info->validity->notBefore = in;
135 }
136 }
137 return (in != NULL);
138}
139
140int X509_set_notBefore(X509 *x, const ASN1_TIME *tm)
141{
142 return X509_set1_notBefore(x, tm);
143}
144
145const ASN1_TIME *X509_get0_notBefore(const X509 *x)
146{
147 return x->cert_info->validity->notBefore;
148}
149
150ASN1_TIME *X509_getm_notBefore(X509 *x)
151{
152 // Note this function takes a const |X509| pointer in OpenSSL. We require
153 // non-const as this allows mutating |x|. If it comes up for compatibility,
154 // we can relax this.
155 return x->cert_info->validity->notBefore;
156}
157
158ASN1_TIME *X509_get_notBefore(const X509 *x509)
159{
160 // In OpenSSL, this function is an alias for |X509_getm_notBefore|, but our
161 // |X509_getm_notBefore| is const-correct. |X509_get_notBefore| was
162 // originally a macro, so it needs to capture both get0 and getm use cases.
163 return x509->cert_info->validity->notBefore;
164}
165
166int X509_set1_notAfter(X509 *x, const ASN1_TIME *tm)
167{
168 ASN1_TIME *in;
169
170 if ((x == NULL) || (x->cert_info->validity == NULL))
171 return (0);
172 in = x->cert_info->validity->notAfter;
173 if (in != tm) {
174 in = ASN1_STRING_dup(tm);
175 if (in != NULL) {
176 ASN1_TIME_free(x->cert_info->validity->notAfter);
177 x->cert_info->validity->notAfter = in;
178 }
179 }
180 return (in != NULL);
181}
182
183int X509_set_notAfter(X509 *x, const ASN1_TIME *tm)
184{
185 return X509_set1_notAfter(x, tm);
186}
187
188const ASN1_TIME *X509_get0_notAfter(const X509 *x)
189{
190 return x->cert_info->validity->notAfter;
191}
192
193ASN1_TIME *X509_getm_notAfter(X509 *x)
194{
195 // Note this function takes a const |X509| pointer in OpenSSL. We require
196 // non-const as this allows mutating |x|. If it comes up for compatibility,
197 // we can relax this.
198 return x->cert_info->validity->notAfter;
199}
200
201ASN1_TIME *X509_get_notAfter(const X509 *x509)
202{
203 // In OpenSSL, this function is an alias for |X509_getm_notAfter|, but our
204 // |X509_getm_notAfter| is const-correct. |X509_get_notAfter| was
205 // originally a macro, so it needs to capture both get0 and getm use cases.
206 return x509->cert_info->validity->notAfter;
207}
208
209void X509_get0_uids(const X509 *x509, const ASN1_BIT_STRING **out_issuer_uid,
210 const ASN1_BIT_STRING **out_subject_uid)
211{
212 if (out_issuer_uid != NULL) {
213 *out_issuer_uid = x509->cert_info->issuerUID;
214 }
215 if (out_subject_uid != NULL) {
216 *out_subject_uid = x509->cert_info->subjectUID;
217 }
218}
219
220int X509_set_pubkey(X509 *x, EVP_PKEY *pkey)
221{
222 if ((x == NULL) || (x->cert_info == NULL))
223 return (0);
224 return (X509_PUBKEY_set(&(x->cert_info->key), pkey));
225}
226
227const STACK_OF(X509_EXTENSION) *X509_get0_extensions(const X509 *x)
228{
229 return x->cert_info->extensions;
230}
231
232const X509_ALGOR *X509_get0_tbs_sigalg(const X509 *x)
233{
234 return x->cert_info->signature;
235}
236
237X509_PUBKEY *X509_get_X509_PUBKEY(const X509 *x509)
238{
239 return x509->cert_info->key;
240}
